content: WORD over all, beautiful as the sky!   Beautiful that war, and all its deeds of carnage, must in time be         utterly lost;   That the hands of the sisters Death and Night, incessantly softly         wash again, and ever again, this soil'd world:   ... For my enemy is dead--a man divine as myself is dead;   I look where he lies, white-faced and still, in the coffin--I draw         near;   I bend down, and touch lightly with my lips the white face in the         coffin.
cleaned: word all beautiful as the sky beautiful that war and all its deeds carnage must time be utterly lost that the hands the sisters death and night incessantly softly wash again and ever again this soil d world my enemy dead a man divine as myself dead i look he lies white faced and still the coffin i draw near i bend down and touch lightly with my lips the white face the coffin
